com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.cache

Interface CacheObserver<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the generic type, you want to listen to.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GeneralCacheObserver
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCacheObserver

    public interface CacheObserver<T>
    This interface, describes how to observe an Cache.

    Since Java has an genius concept called "type-erasure", we have to manually check the Object. Srsly Oracle.. What the f? You could just create an generic flag or whatever.. Google did a better job...

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accept(Object o)
      Defines, whether or not the provided Object should be injected into this Observer or not.
      void deletedEntry(T t, CacheObservable observable)
      Is notified, whenever a new Object is removed from the Cache.
      void newEntry(T t, CacheObservable observable)
      Is notified, whenever a new Object is introduced into the Cache.
      void updatedEntry(T t, CacheObservable observable)
      Is notified, whenever a already existing Object is reintroduced into the Cache.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        boolean accept(Object o)
        Defines, whether or not the provided Object should be injected into this Observer or not.
        Parameters:
        o - the Object that should be tested
        Returns:
        true, if and else false
